title: Meghan Markle's Ex-Boyfriend's *Mom* Hit Twitter to Defend Her Against Bullies and It's Very Sweet
text:
Meghan Markle's Ex-Boyfriend's *Mom* Hit Twitter to Defend Her Against Bullies and It's Very Sweet

View photos Photo credit: Pool/Samir Hussein - Getty Images More

From Cosmopolitan

The mom of Meghan Markle's ex-boyriend Cory Vitiello just hopped on Twitter to defend her against bullies.

Cory and Meghan dated from 2014-2016 and his mom seems to adore her.

Meghan Markle has been going through a rough time lately, and yesterday something truly touching happened. 72 female members of Parliament wrote an open letter expressing their solidarity with (and empathy for) the Duchess. Which had to have felt good!

Meghan's close friend and rumored stylist Jessica Mulroney shared the open letter on Twitter, and guess who hopped into the replies? That'd be Joanne Vitiello, the mother of Meghan's ex-boyfriend, Chef Cory Vitiello.

The tweet has since been deleted, but according to Meghan fan accounts like @duchess_of_sussex, Cory's mom wrote "It's about time! (So sad and shocking that there’s so much jealousy, hostility and bullying directed her way!).”

^Swipe for the tweet!

Meghan and Cory dated between 2014 and 2016 and Joanne previously told The Daily Mail that "we are very fond of her ... she is a lovely, lovely woman. Very smart, very bright, very caring. She's a warm personality, very sincere. We very much enjoyed the time we spent with her. She fitted very well into our family. The Royal Family, and Britain, is very lucky to have her."

It's honestly wonderful that someone from Meghan's past is being so supportive (wish I could say the same about her own family, ahem!), and again—this letter from the MPs is pretty amazing. Read it in full right here:

Women MPs from all political parties have put aside our differences to stand in solidarity with the Duchess of Sussex today and are sending her this open letter. pic.twitter.com/ytLHG5qPf4 — Holly Lynch MP (@HollyLynch5) October 29, 2019
